body_html: @carltonwang you can use https://github.com/yaroslavvb/memory_util to get a timeline of all tensor allocations/deallocations, determine which tensors are getting allocated that are taking so much space, and then decide if this is intentional (requested by your program), or not
body_text: @carltonwang you can use https://github.com/yaroslavvb/memory_util to get a timeline of all tensor allocations/deallocations, determine which tensors are getting allocated that are taking so much space, and then decide if this is intentional (requested by your program), or not
body: @carltonwang you can use https://github.com/yaroslavvb/memory_util to get a timeline of all tensor allocations/deallocations, determine which tensors are getting allocated that are taking so much space, and then decide if this is intentional (requested by your program), or not
